facts.text: Draft scheme published on July 29, 1960, objections invited from operators and public.
Petitioner in Petition No. 117 filed objection on August 24, 1960.
Original date fixed for hearing of objections: September 16, 1960, notice given to all objectors as required by s. 68D(2) and Rules.
Petitioner did not appear on September 16, 1960; other objectors appeared and prayed for time, hearing adjourned to September 21, 1960.

Fresh notice of adjourned hearing on September 21 sent to petitioner as abundant caution, but could not be delivered before September 21 as petitioner absent from address, received on September 23, 1960.
Minister heard objections on September 21, 1960, and passed orders approving scheme on September 22, 1960.

In Orissa Legislative Assembly, Transport Minister (who heard objections) replied to question that Government decided to take over all privately operated motor routes from April 1, 1961, eliminating private operators.

Allegation that Minister stated to certain persons (municipal councillor and advocate of Cuttack) that as Ganjam district (his constituency) routes nationalised, determined to annihilate private bus operators in Cuttack district; denied by State, no affidavits from alleged persons.
Order of Regional Transport Authority dated December 17, 1960, rendering permits of petitioners ineffective from April 1, 1961.
Draft scheme mentioned date of operation as April 1, 1961; final scheme published without mentioning date, but refers to draft scheme approved without modification.
Notification under s. 68C published by Colonel K. Ray, Indian Army (Retd.), Transport Controller, Orissa, in-charge of State Transport Undertaking, Orissa.

legal_issues.text: No hearing given to petitioner in Petition No. 117 as required by s. 68D(2) and Rules under Chap. IV-A.
Minister who heard objections under s. 68D(2) was biased, rendering approval invalid.
Order of Regional Transport Authority dated December 17, 1960, rendering permits ineffective from April 1, 1961, illegal as violating s. 68F and r. 10 under Chap. IV-A.
State Transport Undertaking did not apply for permits six weeks before April 1, 1961, as required by s. 57(2), making issue of permits bad.
Final scheme did not mention date from which to come into operation as required by r. 3(vi) of Orissa Rules.
Transport Controller had no authority to publish the scheme.

petitioner_arguments.text: Notice of hearing on September 21 received on September 23, no opportunity for hearing before Minister, violating s. 68D(2) and r. 8.
petitioner_arguments.legal_basis: s. 68D(2) of Motor Vehicles Act; r. 8 Orissa Rules under Chap. IV-A

petitioner_arguments.text: Minister biased: (1) Assembly reply showed predetermined to take over all routes from April 1, 1961; (2) Stated intent to annihilate private operators in Cuttack.
RTA order December 17, 1960 illegal violating s. 68F and r. 10.
State Transport Undertaking did not apply for permits six weeks before April 1 per s. 57(2).
Final scheme did not mention date of operation per r. 3(vi) Orissa Rules.
Transport Controller had no authority to publish; notification shows personal opinion, not State Transport Undertaking's.

respondent_arguments.text: Original notice for September 16 given; adjournment at instance of objectors, no fresh 10-day notice required for adjourned date; petitioner duty to appear on first date.
Minister's Assembly reply was policy statement, not personal bias; allegation of statement to persons denied, hearsay without affidavits from witnesses.
Points 3 and 4 not raised in petitions, only in stay affidavit not pursued; no reply filed as not in main petitions.
Final scheme refers to draft scheme (with date April 1, 1961) approved without modification, substantial compliance with r. 3(vi).
Transport Controller is chief officer of State Transport Undertaking, authorized to publish; notification shows Undertaking's opinion via in-charge officer; point not pleaded in petitions.

court_reasoning.text: r. 8 requires 10 clear days notice only for first hearing date (Sept 16); no need for fresh notice for adjourned date (Sept 21) at instance of objectors; notice sent as abundant caution.
court_reasoning.key_observation: Petitioner had duty to appear on first date; no force in contention.

court_reasoning.text: Assembly reply was Government policy, not personal bias or predetermination; allegation of statement hearsay, denied by State, no affidavits from alleged witnesses.
Points 3 and 4 not mentioned in petitions, only in unpursued stay affidavit; cannot raise first time in arguments without opportunity for State reply.
Final scheme publishes draft approved without modification, date incorporated by reference; substantial compliance with r. 3(vi).
court_reasoning.key_observation: Scheme not bad for non-mention of date.

court_reasoning.text: Transport Controller as chief officer can publish scheme per s. 68C; notification by in-charge sufficient; whether Undertaking satisfied is question of fact not pleaded.

holdings.text: No violation of s. 68D(2) and r. 8; notice for adjourned hearing not required.
Points 3 and 4 not entertainable as not pleaded.
Transport Controller authorized to publish; compliance with s. 68C.

statutes_cited.name: Motor Vehicles Act, 1939
statutes_cited.relevance: Governing approval and publication of transport schemes, permits, hearings; court found compliance or substantial compliance.

statutes_cited.name: Orissa Rules under Chap. IV-A of Motor Vehicles Act
statutes_cited.relevance: Rules on notice for hearings, publication details; court interpreted as not requiring fresh notice for adjournments, substantial compliance for date.

statutes_cited.name: Constitution of India
statutes_cited.relevance: Basis for petitions enforcing fundamental rights.

outcome.summary: Court rejected all six contentions raised by petitioners challenging validity of road transport scheme approved under s. 68D(2); scheme upheld as validly approved and published.

key_quotes.text: "Rule 8 only applies to the first date to be fixed for hearing. Thereafter if the hearing is adjourned, it is in our opinion unnecessary to give a further notice at all for the adjourned date."
key_quotes.speaker: court
key_quotes.significance: Clarifies requirement under r. 8 for adjourned hearings.

key_quotes.text: "This answer was merely an indication of the Governments policy... It cannot be said that this announcement... meant that the Government was determined whatever happened to eliminate all privately operated routes by April 1, 1961."
key_quotes.speaker: court
key_quotes.significance: Rejects bias claim based on policy statement.

key_quotes.text: "It seems to us that the rule so read has been substantially complied with, for the notification publishing the final scheme refers to the draft scheme and says that the draft scheme is approved and there is no mention of any modification."
key_quotes.speaker: court
key_quotes.significance: Holds substantial compliance with r. 3(vi) sufficient.
